'''Al-Gama'a''' ({{lang-ar|Ø§ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ø¹Ø©}}) is a [[Egypt|Egyptian]] [[Drama]], [[Historical drama film|Historical]], and [[Political drama]] series written by [[Wahid Hamid]] and directed by [[Mohammed Yasin]] and the production of [[Kamel Abu Ali]] began filming in the series in January [[2010]] with a budget of 50 million Egyptian pounds <ref name="Egyptian Censorship allows the series ''Al-Gama'a'' without any comments">[http://www.egypty.com/art-details.aspx?art=5255 Egyptian Censorship allows the series ''Al-Gama'a'' without any comments]</ref>. The Show deals with the rise of the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], Egyptâs largest [[Islamist|Islamist political group]], and it's founder '''[[Hasan Al-Banna]]'''. The Muslim Brotherhood that is banned but tolerated in [[Egypt]]. While the production is impeccable, critics have pouted at the blatant pro-government stance of the show, saying that it is getting audiences ready for [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2010|upcoming parliamentary elections later this year]], in which Muslim Brotherhood members enjoyed great success in the election before because of the charitable contributions they make to their communities<ref name="It is tradition that makes holy month memorable">[http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100828/WEEKENDER/708279835/1080/NATIONAL It is tradition that makes holy month memorable]</ref>.
+
'''Al-Gama'a''' ({{lang-ar|Ø§ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ø¹Ø©}}) is a [[Egypt|Egyptian]] [[Drama]], [[Historical drama film|Historical]], and [[Political drama]] series written by [[Wahid Hamid]] and directed by [[Mohammed Yasin]] and the production of [[Kamel Abu Ali]] began filming in the series in January [[2010]] with a budget of 50 million Egyptian pounds <ref name="Egyptian Censorship allows the series ''Al-Gama'a'' without any comments">[http://www.egypty.com/art-details.aspx?art=5255 Egyptian Censorship allows the series ''Al-Gama'a'' without any comments]</ref>. The Show deals with the rise of the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], Egyptâs largest [[Islamist|Islamist political group]]. The Muslim Brotherhood that is banned but tolerated in [[Egypt]]. While the production is impeccable, critics have pouted at the blatant pro-government stance of the show, saying that it is getting audiences ready for [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2010|upcoming parliamentary elections later this year]], in which Muslim Brotherhood members enjoyed great success in [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2005|the election before]] because of the charitable contributions they make to their communities<ref name="It is tradition that makes holy month memorable">[http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100828/WEEKENDER/708279835/1080/NATIONAL It is tradition that makes holy month memorable]</ref>.

Line 31: Line 31:
== Season synopses ==
== Season synopses ==
=== Season 1 ===
=== Season 1 ===
â
{{Expand-section|date=September 2010}}
+
The show begins with a true incident when ''Muslim Brotherhood'' students held demonstrations in al-Azhar and [[Cairo University]] campuses to protest vote rigging in the 2006 student union elections. At [[Al-Azhar University]], demonstrators held a military-like parade that sent shock waves to many observers, who questioned the groupâs claim of renouncing violence. Upon their arrest, the ''Muslim Brotherhood'' student suspects are interviewed by a police officers. One of the police officer ('''Ashraf Helal''') refuses to interview then because he knows nothing about them. Ashraf Helal looks for books about the Muslim Brotherhood but he finds that there are way too many books about the subject. Later, he meets an old female friend ('''Shirin''') and tells her about his station. She suggest that he talks to her grandfather ('''Chancellor Abdallah Kassab'''). Chancellor Abdallah Kassab gives officer Ashraf Helal a list of books to read about ''Muslim Brotherhood'' and its founder, '''[[Hasan Al-Banna]]'''. The show then begins showing Hasan al-banna story from childhood until 1948 when the government of Egypt decides to abolish the ''Muslim Brotherhood''. During the season, the show jumps back and forth to hasan al-banna's time and the current time.
